description:
Refactor TanStack Start Full-Stack to Frontend-Only Architecture

Transform the current PostgreSQL/Drizzle/Better Auth full-stack application into a clean frontend-only architecture that consumes external APIs. The existing UI design and components should remain unchanged while replacing all server-side infrastructure with a centralized API service layer.

Requirements:

Remove Backend Infrastructure
- Delete src/db/ directory containing schema, migrations, and configuration files
- Remove all Drizzle ORM dependencies from package.json
- Uninstall Better Auth and remove all authentication middleware
- Remove S3/R2 storage infrastructure and delete upload handlers
- Delete all server-side API routes and tRPC/router implementations
- Clean up server middleware, server functions, and session management code

Implement API Service Layer
- Create src/api-services/ directory with organized service modules
- Build base HTTP client with request/response interceptors for auth tokens and error handling
- Implement service modules for each domain (auth, users, files, etc.)
- Define TypeScript interfaces matching external API contracts
- Add request/response transformers for data normalization

Refactor Frontend Architecture
- Convert src/routes/ to frontend-only TanStack Router routes
- Update all components to use new API hooks instead of server functions
- Transform src/hooks/ to use TanStack Query for external API calls
- Replace internal authentication with external provider integration (OAuth/JWT flow)
- Update file upload components to use presigned URLs or direct client-side uploads

Update Configuration and Documentation
- Remove server-specific build configuration from build tools
- Update Vite config for frontend-only deployment
- Remove database connection strings and server secrets from environment variables
- Add external API base URL configuration to environment
- Update TypeScript paths and build targets for frontend-only
- Update docs/architecture.md to reflect the new frontend-only architecture

Acceptance Criteria
- Application builds and runs without any backend dependencies
- All data fetching flows through the centralized API service layer
- Users can authenticate via external provider with persistent session management
- File upload and download operations work through external storage APIs
- Build outputs static assets suitable for CDN deployment
- Architecture documentation accurately describes the new frontend-only pattern
